chafe.meaning: become or make annoyed or impatient because of a restriction or inconvenience

subtle.meaning: so delicate or precise as to be difficult to analyse or describe

threshold.meaning: a point of entry, a barrier that must be crossed

nostalgic.meaning: feeling, evoking, or characterized by nostalgia; feeling from the past

asphalt.meaning: a mixture of dark pitch with sand or gravel, used for surfacing roads

tarmac.meaning: material used for surfacing roads or other outdoor areas

periphery.meaning: the outer limits or edge of an area or object.

desolate.meaning: feeling or showing great unhappiness or loneliness

despondent.meaning: in low spirits from loss of hope or courage

sully.meaning: make dirty; damage the purity of

sooty.meaning: covered with or coloured like soot

solitude.meaning: the state or situation of being alone

prowl.meaning: move about restlessly and stealthily, especially in search of prey

gnarled.meaning: knobbly, rough, and twisted, especially with age

poignant.meaning: evoking a keen sense of sadness or regret

mingle.meaning: mix or cause to mix together

tapestry.meaning: a heavy cloth that has designs or pictures woven into it and that is used for wall hangings, curtains

erode.meaning: be gradually worn away by natural agents

haphazard.meaning: lacking any obvious principle of organization

chime.meaning: a melodious ringing sound, as produced by striking a bell

adherence.meaning: attachment or commitment to a person, cause, or belief; being faithful to

casualty.meaning: a person killed or injured in a war or accident

imbue.meaning: to fill something or someone with a particular feeling, quality, or idea

seclude.meaning: keep someone away from other people

ripple.meaning: a small wave or series of waves on the surface of water

immerse.meaning: dip or submerge in a liquid

indulge.meaning: allow oneself to enjoy the pleasure of

hammock.meaning: a swinging couch or bed supports by ropes at both ends

lull.meaning: calm or send to sleep, typically with soothing sounds

exotic.meaning: originating in or characteristic of a distant foreign country

credulous.meaning: having or showing too great a readiness to believe things

implausible.meaning: not seeming reasonable or probable; failing to convince

Adverse.meaning: having a negative or harmful effect on something.

Transition.meaning: a change from one form or type to another, or the process by which this happens

Superficial.meaning: never thinking about things that are serious or important.

Adolescent.meaning: a young person who is developing into an adult.

Accumulate.meaning: to collect a large number of something over a long period of time.

Interval.meaning: a period between two events or times.

Advocate.meaning: to publicly support or suggest an idea, development, or way of doing something.

Affectionate.meaning: showing feelings of liking or love.

Precede.meaning: to be or go before something or someone in time or space.

Agenda.meaning: a list of aims or possible future achievements.

Allege.meaning: to say that someone has done something illegal or wrong without giving proof.

Inherent.meaning: existing as a natural or basic part of something.

Intuition.meaning: an ability to understand or know something immediately based on your feelings rather than facts.

Ambiguous.meaning: having or expressing more than one possible meaning, sometimes intentionally.

Analogy.meaning: a comparison between things that have similar features, often used to help a principle or idea.

Analogous to.meaning: having similar features to another thing and therefore able to be compared with it.

Offspring.meaning: the young of an animal or a person's children.

Intrude.meaning: to go into a place or situation in which you are not wanted or not expected to be

Exclaim.meaning: to say or shout something suddenly because of surprise, fear, pleasure, etc.

Ironic.meaning: interesting, strange, or funny because of being very different from what you would usually expect.

Extremist.meaning: someone who has beliefs that most people think are unreasonable and unacceptable.

Awe.meaning: a feeling of great respect sometimes mixed with fear or surprise.

Torrential.meaning: used to refer to very heavy rain.

Arouse.meaning: to cause someone to have a particular feeling.

Sentiment.meaning: a thought, opinion, or idea based on a feeling about a situation, or a way of thinking about something.

Lucrative.meaning: (especially of a business, job, or activity) producing a lot of money.

Pathetic.meaning: causing feelings of sadness, sympathy, or sometimes lack of respect, especially because a person or an animal is suffering.

Compliment.meaning: a remark that expresses approval, admiration, or respect.

Merge.meaning: to combine or join together, or to cause things to do this.

Shrewd.meaning: having or showing sharp powers of judgement; astute.

Extravagant.meaning: spending too much money, or using too much of something.

Slender.meaning: thin and delicate, often in a way that is attractive.

Interpretation.meaning: an explanation or opinion of what something means.

Vague.meaning: A vague person is not able to think clearly, or gives an impression of not thinking clearly in order to hide their real thoughts.

Interim.meaning: temporary and intended to be used or accepted until something permanent exists.

Superior.meaning: A superior person believes that or acts as if they are better than other people.

Surpass.meaning: to do or be better than.

Thrill.meaning: to make someone feel very excited and pleased.

Trauma.meaning: severe and lasting emotional shock and pain caused by an extremely upsetting experience, or a case of such shock happening.

Bind.meaning: to tie something or someone tightly or to fasten something.

Bland.meaning: not having a strong taste or character or not showing any interest or energy.

Bleak.meaning: If a situation is bleak, there is little or no hope for the future (2) If a place is bleak, it is empty, and not welcoming or attractive.

Blister.meaning: a painful swelling on the skin that contains liquid, caused usually by continuous rubbing, especially on your foot, or by burning.

Swell.meaning: to become larger and rounder than usual; to (cause to) increase in size or amount.

Blunt.meaning: A blunt pencil, knife, etc. is not sharp and therefore not able to write, cut, etc. Well.

Breadth.meaning: the fact of including many different things, features, subjects, or qualities.

Breed.meaning: to cause something to happen, usually something bad.

Resent.meaning: to feel angry because you have been forced to accept someone or something that you do not like.

Brink.meaning: the point where a new or different situation is about to begin.

Burst.meaning: to feel a strong emotion, or strong wish to do something.

Indulge.meaning: to allow yourself or another person to have something enjoyable, especially more than is good for you.

Patriotism.meaning: the feeling of loving your country more than any others and being proud of it.

Elaborate.meaning: containing a lot of careful details or many detailed parts.

Inscription.meaning: words that are written or cut in something.

Wear.meaning: to show a particular emotion on your face.

Incur.meaning: to experience something, usually something unpleasant, as a result of actions you have taken

Discreet.meaning: careful not to cause embarrassment or attract too much attention, especially by keeping something secret

Fulfil.meaning: to satisfy someone or to make someone feel happy

Propensity.meaning: the fact that someone is likely to behave in a particular way, especially a bad way

Demure.meaning: (especially of women) quiet and well behaved

Demur.meaning: to express disagreement or refuse to do something

Inflict.meaning: to force someone to experience something very unpleasant

Surplus.meaning: (an amount that is) more than is needed

Deem.meaning: to consider or judge something in a particular way

Apologetic.meaning: showing that you feel sorry about having caused someone problems or unhappiness

Arbitrary.meaning: based on chance rather than being planned or based on reason

Imply.meaning: to communicate an idea or feeling without saying it directly (2) (as something implies) used to show that the name, explanation, etc. of something tells you something else about it

Assert.meaning: to behave in a way that expresses your confidence, importance, or power and earns you respect from others; assert

Calf.meaning: the thick curved part at the back of the human leg between the knee and the foot

Torn.meaning: finding it difficult to choose between two possibilities

Catastrophe.meaning: a sudden event that causes very great trouble or destruction

Chronic.meaning: (especially of a disease or something bad) continuing for a long time

Circuit.meaning: a regular pattern of visits or the places visited

Clich√©.meaning: a phrase, remark, or opinion that has very often been said or expressed before and is therefore not original and not interesting

Coherent.meaning: If an argument, set of ideas, or a plan is coherent, it is clear and carefully considered, and each part of it connects or follows in a natural or reasonable way

Dispute.meaning: an argument or disagreement, especially an official one between, for example, workers and employers or two countries with a common border

Consistent.meaning: always behaving or happening in a similar, especially positive, way

Commemorate.meaning: to remember officially and give respect to a great person or event, especially by a public ceremony or by making a statue or special building

Compensate.meaning: to provide something good or useful in place of something or to make someone feel better about something that has failed or been lost or missed

Compromise.meaning: We would never compromise the safety of our passengers

Compulsive.meaning: doing something a lot and unable to stop doing it

Impulsive.meaning: showing behaviour in which you do things suddenly without any planning and without considering the effects they may have

Conceited.meaning: too proud of yourself and your actions and abilities

Concession.meaning: a reduction in the usual price of something, made available to students, old people, etc

Condemn.meaning: to criticize something or someone strongly, usually for moral reasons

Confront.meaning: to face, meet, or deal with a difficult situation or person

Strive.meaning: to try very hard to do something or to make something happen, especially for a long time or against difficulties

Smug.meaning: proud; too pleased or satisfied about something you have achieved or something you know

Consensus.meaning: a generally accepted opinion or decision among a group of people

Constitution.meaning: the general state of someone's health

Subtle.meaning: not loud, bright, noticeable, or obvious in any way

Legible.meaning: Legible writing or print can be read easily

Adorn.meaning: to add something decorative to a person or thing

Ignite.meaning: to (cause to) start burning or explode

Illuminate.meaning: to light something and make it brighter

Waft.meaning: to (cause to) move gently through the air

Frown.meaning: to bring your eyebrows together so that there are lines on your face above your eyes, often while turning the corners of your mouth downwards, showing that you are annoyed, worried, sad, or thinking hard

Volition.meaning: the power to make your own decisions

Carouse.meaning: to enjoy yourself by drinking alcohol and speaking and laughing loudly in a group of people

Peer.meaning: to look carefully or with difficult

Shrug.meaning: to raise your shoulders and then lower them in order to say you do not know or are not interested

Limp.meaning: to walk slowly and with difficulty because of having an injured or painful leg or foot

Stiff.meaning: behaving in a way that is formal and not relaxed

Adamant.meaning: impossible to persuade, or unwilling to change an opinion or decision

Lump.meaning: a piece of a solid substance, usually with no particular shape

Fidget.meaning: to make continuous, small movements, especially if they do not have a particular purpose and you make them without meaning to, for example because you are nervous or bored

Lap.meaning: the top surface of the upper part of the legs of a person who is sitting down

Scuff.meaning: a mark made by scraping or grazing a surface or object

Graze.meaning: to break the surface of the skin by rubbing against something rough

Usher.meaning: to show someone where they should go, or to make someone go where you want them to go

Cramped.meaning: not having enough space or time

Velvet.meaning: a cloth usually made from silk or cotton with a thick, soft surface

Cascade.meaning: to fall quickly and in large amounts

Cling.meaning: to stick onto or hold something or someone tightly, or to refuse to stop holding it, him, or her

Custody.meaning: the legal right or duty to care for someone or something, especially a child after its parents have separated or died

Permed.meaning: (of hair) made curly using a special chemical

Porcelain.meaning: a hard but delicate, shiny, white substance made by heating a special type of clay to a high temperature, used to make cups, plates, decorations, etc.

Seep.meaning: to move or spread slowly out of a hole or through something

Swirl.meaning: to move quickly with a twisting, circular movement, or to make something do this

Porous.meaning: Something that is porous has many small holes, so liquid or air can pass through, especially slowly

Scrutinise.meaning: to examine something very carefully in order to discover information

Exorbitantly.meaning: in a way that is much too much, or much too expensive

Ward off.meaning: to prevent someone or something unpleasant from harming or coming close to you

Permeate.meaning: to spread through something and be present in every part of it

Feat.meaning: something difficult needing a lot of skill, strength, courage, etc. to achieve it

Shriek.meaning: a short, loud, high cry, especially one produced suddenly as an expression of a powerful emotion

Rapt.meaning: giving complete attention, or showing complete involvement, or (of attention) complete

Crush.meaning: a crowd of people forced to stand close together

Infatuation.meaning: strong but not usually lasting feelings of love or attraction

Slip.meaning: to go somewhere or put something somewhere quickly, often so that you are not noticed

Prominent.meaning: Something that is in a prominent position can easily be seen or noticed

Glare.meaning: to look directly and continuously at someone or something in an angry way/ unpleasantly bright or strong light

Part.meaning: to separate or cause something or someone to separate

Residue.meaning: the part that is left after the main part has gone or been taken away, or a substance that remains after a chemical process such as evaporation

Admission.meaning: the act of agreeing that something is true, especially unwillingly

Frivolous.meaning: behaving in a silly way and not taking anything seriously

Mystify.meaning: to confuse someone by being or doing something very strange or impossible to explain

Disdain.meaning: the feeling of not liking someone or something and thinking that they do not deserve your interest or respect

Wrinkle.meaning: a small line in the skin caused by old age

Cane.meaning: a long stick used especially by old, ill, or blind people to help them walk

Perplexing.meaning: confusing, often because you do not know how to solve something

Shabby.meaning: looking old and in bad condition because of being used for a long time or not being cared for / not honourable or fair; unacceptable

Hover.meaning: to stand somewhere, especially near another person, eagerly or nervously waiting for their attention

Beckon.meaning: to move your hand or head in a way that tells someone to come nearer

Curtsy.meaning: When a girl or woman curtsies, she bends quickly at the knees, with one foot in front of the other, often while holding her skirt, especially to show respect

Sternly.meaning: in a way that shows disapproval

Clasp.meaning: to hold someone or something firmly in your hands

Furrow.meaning: a long line or hollow that is formed or cut into the surface of something

Mumble.meaning: to speak quietly and in a way that is not clear so that the words are difficult to understand

Wager.meaning: used to say that you are certain that something is true or will happen in the future

Innate.meaning: an innate quality or ability is one that you were born with, not one you have learnt

Leeway.meaning: freedom to act withing particular limits

Eccentric.meaning: strange or unusual, sometimes in a humourous way

Temperament.meaning: the part of your character that affects your moods and the way you behave

Condolence.meaning: sympathy and sadness for the family or close friends of a person who has recently died, or an expression of this, especially in written form

Refute.meaning: to say or prove that a person, statement, opinion, etc. is wrong or false

Transaction.meaning: an occasion when someone buys or sells something, or when money is exchanged or the activity of buying or selling something

Haze.meaning: something such as heat or smoke in the air that makes it less clear, so that it is difficult to see wel

l Fawn over.meaning: to praise someone too much and give them a lot of attention that is not sincere, in order to get a positive reaction

Stumble.meaning: to step awkwardly while walking or running and fall or begin to fall

Scowl.meaning: to look at someone or something with a very annoyed expression

Deviation.meaning: the action of being or doing something that is different from the usual or common way of behaving

Tumble.meaning: to fall quickly and without control

Dissipate.meaning: to (cause to) gradually disappear or waste

Incandescent.meaning: producing a bright light from a heated filament or other part/ extremely bright

Remedial.meaning: A remedial action is intended to correct something that is wrong or to improve a bad situation

Pristine.meaning: new or almost new, and in very good condition

Crescent.meaning: (something with) a curved shape that has two narrow pointed ends, like the moon when it is less than half of a circle

Tarnish.meaning: to make or (especially of metal) become less bright or a different colour

Render.meaning: to cause someone or something to be in a particular state

Topple.meaning: to (cause to) lose balance and fall down

Dazed.meaning: very confused and unable to think clearly

Strangle.meaning: to kill someone by pressing their throat so that they cannot breathe

Luscious.meaning: having a pleasant sweet taste or containing a lot of juice

Cringe.meaning: to suddenly move away from someone or something because you are frightened

Slick.meaning: operating or performing skilfully and effectively, without problems and without seeming to need effort

Deception.meaning: the act of hiding the truth, especially to get an advantage

Meld.meaning: to (cause something to) combine with something else

Palpable.meaning: so obvious that it can easily be seen or known, or (of a feeling) so strong that it seems as if it can be touched or physically felt

Draw.meaning: to take air or smoke into your lungs

Muffled.meaning: A muffled sound is quiet or not clear

Thump.meaning: to hit something and cause a noise

Surreal.meaning: strange; not seeming real; like a dream

Descendant.meaning: a person who is related to you and who lives after you, such as your child or grandchild

Spectrum.meaning: the set of colours into which a beam of light can be separated, or a range of waves, such as light waves or radio waves

Correlation.meaning: a connection or relationship between two or more facts, numbers, etc.

Complacence.meaning: a feeling of calm satisfaction with your own abilities or situation that prevents you from trying harder

Riot.meaning: an occasion when a large number of people behave in a noisy, violent, and uncontrolled way in public, often as a protest

Castigate.meaning: to criticize someone or something severely

Admonish.meaning: to tell someone that they have done something wrong/ to advise someone to do something

Tempting.meaning: If something is tempting, you want to do or have it

Creep.meaning: to move slowly, quietly, and carefully, usually in order to avoid being noticed

Sporadic.meaning: happening sometimes; not regular or continuous

Orthodox.meaning: (of beliefs, ideas, or activities) considered traditional, normal, and acceptable by most people Indelible

Traverse.meaning: to move or travel through an area

Imposition.meaning: a situation in which someone expects another person to do something that they do not want to do or that is not convenient

Pace.meaning: a single step, or the distance you move when you take a single step

Ruminate.meaning: to think carefully and for a long period about something

Catharsis.meaning: the process of releasing strong emotions through a particular activity or experience, such as writing or theatre, in a way that helps you to understand those emotions

Docile.meaning: quiet and easy to influence, persuade, or control

Adroit.meaning: very skilful and quick in the way you think or move

Precarious.meaning: in a dangerous state because of not being safe or not being held in place firmly

Ornately.meaning: in a way that has a lot of complicated decoration

Dazzling.meaning: A dazzling light is so bright that you cannot see for a short time after looking at it/ extremely attractive

Spectacle.meaning: an unusual or unexpected event or situation that attracts attention, interest, or disapproval

Transcendent.meaning: greater, better, more important, or going past or above all others

Intricate.meaning: having a lot of small parts that are arranged in a complicated or delicate way

Perilous.meaning: last but one in a series of things; second last

Posterity.meaning: the people who will exist in the future

Provoke.meaning: to cause a reaction, especially a negative one

Tentatively.meaning: in a way that shows you are not certain or confident

Discern.meaning: to see, recognize, or understand something that is not clear

Yield.meaning: to supply or produce something positive such as a profit, an amount of food or information

Marginal.meaning: very small in amount or effect

Torment.meaning: great mental suffering and unhappiness, or great physical pain

Triumph.meaning: a very great success, achievement, or victory (= when you win a war, fight, or competition), or a feeling of great satisfaction or pleasure caused by this

Retract.meaning: to take back an offer or statement, etc. or admit that a statement was false

Novelty.meaning: something that has not been experienced before and so is interesting/ the quality of being new and unusual

Trespass.meaning: to go onto someone's land or enter their building without permission

Concoct.meaning: to make something, usually food, by adding several different parts together, often in a way that is original or not planned

Whim.meaning: a sudden wish or idea, especially one that cannot be reasonably explained

Infiltrate.meaning: to secretly become part of a group in order to get information or to influence the way that group thinks or behaves
